meanings.definition: Inflammation of the pharynx, causing a sore throat.
meanings.sent1: Pharyngitis can make your throat feel very sore.
meanings.sent2: I had to stay home from school because of pharyngitis.
meanings.sent3: Even though it's called pharyngitis, it's not a fun party in your throat.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, like pharyngitis spreading in a quiet space.
meanings.sent5: The redness and swelling of pharyngitis made it hard to ignore the discomfort.

meanings.definition: A condition characterized by pain and irritation in the throat.
meanings.sent1: The doctor diagnosed me with pharyngitis after my throat started hurting.
meanings.sent2: Pharyngitis can make it hard to swallow without feeling pain.
meanings.sent3: Trying to sing with pharyngitis felt like a cat scratching at my throat.
meanings.sent4: The tension in the room was palpable, like a silent pharyngitis waiting to be noticed.
meanings.sent5: The persistent coughing from pharyngitis was a constant reminder of the discomfort.

meanings.definition: An infection or irritation of the throat, typically causing difficulty swallowing.
meanings.sent1: Pharyngitis can make it feel like there's a lump in your throat.
meanings.sent2: I had to drink warm tea to soothe the pharyngitis and help with swallowing.
meanings.sent3: Dealing with pharyngitis was like having a tiny monster in my throat causing trouble.
meanings.sent4: The pharyngitis spread through the school like wildfire, affecting many students.
meanings.sent5: The sharp pain of pharyngitis made each swallow a challenge to overcome.
